DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Revumenib citrate works by binding to a protein called menin. This prevents menin from interacting with a rearranged form of the KMT2A protein made by an abnormal KMT2A gene found in some leukemia cells. Blocking the interaction between menin and the rearranged KMT2A protein helps slow or stop the growth of leukemia cells. Revumenib citrate is a type of targeted therapy called a menin inhibitor.
DrugInfoMetaData.FDAExternalRef: FDA label information for this drug is available at DailyMed.

Para.ExternalRef: FDA label information for this drug is available at DailyMed.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Revumenib citrate is approved to treat adults and children aged 1 year and older with:

ItemizedList.ListItem: acute leukemia that has an abnormal KMT2A gene and has come back or did not respond to previous treatment

Section.Para: Revumenib citrate is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.
